summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 discussing draft remarks from the FBI regarding the Epstein case. The sender provides editorial feedback on the draft, correcting a timeline error and clarifying language about how victims were described, specifically objecting to the phrasing that victims 'were made to give' massages.

events.title: Epstein Abuse Timeline Reference
events.description: The document references the period 2002-2005 in relation to the allegations against Jeffrey Epstein, noting it is a four-year period.

keyFacts: An email from July 2019 shows internal coordination on public remarks about the Epstein case between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the FBI.
The sender corrects a factual error in the draft remarks, noting the period 2002-2005 is four years, not three.

The sender strongly objects to the draft phrasing that victims 'were made to give' massages, stating there is no allegation or factual basis for that, and suggests the accurate phrasing is 'who gave Epstein massages.'
The sender suggests the FBI consider using the term 'underage girls' instead of 'child' for consistency, as they associate 'child' with pre-puberty.
